name: Ho Chi Minh City
subtitle: South-East Vietnam
description: Ho Chi Minh City is the largest city, business and financial hub of Vietnam. Also known as Saigon, it has a prominent history going back hundreds of years. There are plenty of museums showcasing the country's dark wartime history and classic colonial architecture built by former French rulers.

name: Đồng Nai
subtitle: South-East Vietnam
description: Dong Nai is located right at the economic center zone of the South. It is also the most dynamic area in Vietnam in terms of economic development.

name: Bà Rịa–Vũng Tàu
subtitle: South-East Vietnam
description: Vung Tau is known for its wide range of mouthwatering dishes made with fresh, local ingredients.

name: Binh Duong
subtitle: South-East Vietnam
description: Binh Duong Province, a satellite of Ho Chi Minh City, encompasses historic destinations and fruit orchards, showcasing specialties such as mangosteen

name: Binh Phuoc
subtitle: South-East Vietnam
description: Binh Phuoc has many attractions for tourists, such as Bu Gia Map National Park, Ba Ra Mountain, Thac Mo Lake, Bom Bo Village, and Dong Xoai Martyrs Cemetery.

name: Tay Ninh
subtitle: South-East Vietnam
description: Tay Ninh is home of Cao Dai religion with Tay Ninh Cao Dai Temple, a complex of Great Temple, Chanh Mon Gate, four towers and Mother-of-Buddha Temple.
